Posts.Content: Hi ladies , I also have breast and lymph node cancer stage 2 . I am having my 5th round of chemo in 29th , I then have a 5 week break befor my surgery . Unfortunately I have had every side effect going including burns , really can't wait for my last one in January then the removal of tumour and nodes . Before radiotherapy . Here's hoping for full recovery hey ladies .wishing you the very best of luck xx
Posts.Title: Recently diagnosed breast and lymph node cancer. Chemo in January...

Posts.Content: Hi , you are not alone at all. I am having my last round of chemo in 19th Jan and my was long black hair is now virtually gone and what is left is now white though I am 47 . I have also gained just over a stone have a fat tomatoe face and feel really ugly and not at all like a woman so see your just normal , u wear dresses and makeup but feel like a drag queen  I feel you pain and trust me I am a hairdresser so really do get it . I really hope once my chemo is over this blubber goes away because I'm so swollen I also wish you all the very best . You can buy in eBay or Amazon an oil ..it's called Jamaican black castor oil and it's fab for hair and works a treat once you have some to work with it will strengthen it and encourage fullness it smells but worth it . I leave mine in all day and then wash off before bed .  Good luck  Bev  X
Posts.Title: I'm not 'me'

Posts.Content: You are an inspiration to us all , why should we not travel alone ? Shopping when we like , snoozing in a beach sounds blissful to me !  Hahaha you made me chuckle with the waiter bit , it's amazing how during treatment we lose these feelings hey , but when you are single I guess you kind of get used to that .  Glad to hear your hip will be sorted , more adventures for you coming up then ?  Xx
Posts.Title: There's light at the end of the tunnel, ladies...

Posts.Content: Wow a truly inspiring post !! I was diagnosed in August , just had chemo and last week had my op radiotherapy next :/  The love of my life suddenly found someone else too and I was distraught after he showed me so much care until then still devistated to be honest . I am looking forward to a holiday and also want to go to marocco so will save up on return to work and go x
Posts.Title: There's light at the end of the tunnel, ladies...

Posts.Content: I au am going to give it a read x
Posts.Title: Too Many Hot Flushes

Posts.Content: Hi all , Following my pre op I was told I would be taking Tamoxifen for 10 years following my treatment . After reading up on the drug and reading what other takers say I have been left totally devastated !! I can't stop crying and feel like my life is not worth it anymore . The thought of going through similar side effects to chemo ( hair falling ,weight gain, sickness , flushes ) 10 years of that I don't want to face . My chemo was nasty to me and I had every side effect possible including burns down below and in arms and hands , gained two stone and full of fluid that won't budge , I was thinking at least I'm near the end but then to be hit with that news about Tamoxifen I'm filled with absolute dread and don't know what to do but cry .
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: Can I ask what your water tablets were called ? My gp won't give me any as they are scared to incase my lungs and kidneys can't cope , mentioned to nurses at hospital and although they were sympathetic they simply told me to elivate my legs !! Which I do and it does nothing at all even after hours of lying down with feet up on 4 pillows
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for that it's made me feel a lot more positive now
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: Thank you for your comments and support you ladies have lifted my spirits now
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: Thank you , I've just rang the chemo unit and they are going to call me back after speaking to the dr so hopefully I will get some . I breathe as though I'm a 80 year old smoking asthma sufferer lol can only just climb my stairs
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: Been hospital today , chest X-ray shows my chest is fine so they still won't give me any water tablets !!! I give up with them . I have to go back tomorrow for a scan in my calf just to make sure I don't have a clot , really frustrated as I can only waddle along now
Posts.Title: Tablets

Posts.Content: Bluesy I hope I'm like you then as my chemo was vile and I had every side effect going including burns !! Really hope my radiotherapy is kinder
Posts.Title: How many people worked through RT? Is it doable ?

Posts.Content: Hi kacang thank you for the advice but I've tried anastrozole and I was in agony and very depressed , I've been in Letrozole too for the past 7 months but they are pretty much the same as the rest , the weight gain is horrible as I was just 9 stone when this all began ( dianosis ) now I'm 11 stone 2lb
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: I am exactly the same on Letrozole , I was told this was the last drug for me to try after first having tamoxifen and then anastrazole . A week ago I saw my surgeon who was extremely shocked that I had not been put on calcium tablets , I am so so fed up , I gained 2 stone during treatments but lost a stone of that after a while but now I am so strict with my diet yet I'm gaining weight again , my joints all hurt and to be frank I'd rather sleep all day !
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: I was never told about avoiding certain foods either until the last round of my chemo when a nurse asked that I was avoiding the foods , I was shocked because I wasn't told and had been eating most of them :/
Posts.Title: MacDonalds milkshake?
